intro: Galium idubedae f. pseudopyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean bedstraw, is a rare and endemic subspecies native to the Pyrenees region. It is a low-growing herbaceous plant with slender, sprawling stems that often root at the nodes. Its small, white to pale pink flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the Rubiaceae family. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are usually hairy and have a distinctive waxy coating. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats such as woodland floors and stream banks.
